item.title: WA teenager starts petition for shearing to be in Brisbane 2032 Olympics
item.description: We saw break dancing added to the Olympic program for the Paris Games, and now there is a push for shearing to be included for the Brisbane Olympics in 2032.

item.title: AFL grand final 2025: Brisbane Lions thump Geelong Cats by 47 points, Will Ashcroft wins Norm Smith Medal
item.description: Brisbane secures its second straight AFL premiership, taking control in the final quarter of an otherwise gripping grand final against Geelong.

item.title: Tropical Storm Bualoi sweeps through Philippines leaving 10 dead
item.description: The death toll from a tropical storm that swept across the central Philippines and southern Luzon has risen to 10, as the country's north continued recovering from Super Typhoon Ragasa.

item.title: Fortescue offers measles vaccine boosters after Christmas Creek outbreak
item.description: Iron-ore giant Fortescue says it will offer vaccine boosters after three measles cases were confirmed at its Pilbara mine earlier this month.

item.title: Tourist dies at Tasmania's Cradle Mountain National Park after group becomes 'overwhelmed' by extreme weather
item.description: A group of tourists who were unprepared for the extreme conditions at Cradle Mountain National Park is rescued, but one member of the group dies.

item.title: Cyclist on a gruelling journey to fight for a better future for people with dementia
item.description: Nicholas Tremaine is cycling more than 40,000 kilometres to raise $1 million to fight the condition that's befallen his mother and is now Australia's leading cause of death.

item.title: Clive Palmer ordered to pay more than $13 million after foreign investor claim dismissed
item.description: The decade-long dispute was related to WA government legislation, which impeded Clive Palmer's ability to extract damages over the Balmoral South Iron Ore Project in the Pilbara.

item.title: Indigenous teenager teaches Paakantyi language to teachers at Menindee school
item.description: Jaz Fusi has been passionate about learning Paakantyi language for most of her life. Now, she teaches it to her local school's teachers and is eager to see other kids do the same.

item.title: WA government facing $400m cost blowout over Peel Health Campus redevelopment
item.description: The long-awaited redevelopment of Peel Health Campus is facing a $400 million cost blowout and potential delays, a leaked document reveals.

item.title: All Blacks edge brave Wallabies to retain Bledisloe Cup for 23rd year at Eden Park, Morgan Turinui rants at referee
item.description: The All Blacks have beaten the Wallabies 33-24 at Eden Park, extending their 39-year and counting winning record against Australia at the Auckland venue.

item.title: Relationship experts on the signs that it may be time to call it quits
item.description: If you are feeling indifferent about your relationship, have high conflict, or just don't really enjoy their company anymore, it is possible the partnership has reached its end.

item.title: Snoop Dogg, Baker Boy and Tash Sultana star in AFL grand final entertainment
item.description: The legendary rapper delivered a squeaky clean performance, incorporating local artists and a didgeridoo in a trip through his catalogue.

item.title: Woman, 81, dies after unit fire in Doubleview in Perth's north
item.description: Emergency services found the woman, 81, unresponsive at the scene in Doubleview and took her to hospital, but she couldn't be revived.

item.title: Matt Wright's lawyers reveal five grounds of appeal for Netflix star's guilty verdict, including allegation against judge
item.description: Matt Wright's lawyers have revealed the five grounds they are seeking to appeal their client's guilty verdict on, including an allegation that the judge made an "impermissible comment to the jury".

item.title: Lions star Will Ashcroft wins second consecutive Norm Smith Medal
item.description: Will Ashcroft claims back-to-back Norm Smith Medals after playing a starring role in the Brisbane Lions' grand final win over Geelong.

item.title: How the internet reacted to the Brisbane Lions winning the AFL grand final
item.description: Brisbane completed an historic back-to-back premiership, beating a wounded Geelong at the MCG, and the internet followed along with every kick.

item.title: Brisbane's back-to-back AFL grand final wins suggest we could be back in a 'Lions era'
item.description: The Lions successfully defended their premiership to go back-to-back, and pose the question: Are we back in a Lions era?

item.title: AFL grand final quick hits: Lions' Lachie Neale gamble pays off, Cats' Jeremy Cameron in the wars, and it's Country Road time at the MCG
item.description: Brisbane's gamble on Lachie Neale's fitness pays off with a team-lifting goal, a brave Jeremy Cameron has a painful day out, and Charlie Cameron's goals provide a Country Road soundtrack at the MCG. Here are the quick hits from the 2025 AFL grand final.

item.title: Two teenagers among three charged after woman injured in alleged carjacking on the Gold Coast
item.description: The woman was injured when she was hit by a vehicle during an alleged car theft while she was unloading groceries at her home on the Gold Coast.

item.title: White House releases photo of Donald Trump and Anthony Albanese
item.description: A photo of a smiling Donald Trump, alongside Anthony Albanese, his fiancée Jodie Haydon and US First Lady Melania Trump, has been released by the White House.

item.title: Chinese presence in the Pacific runs deep and is now reshaped by Beijing's ambitions
item.description: China's presence in the Pacific is often viewed in the context of geopolitical tension and rivalry. But Chinese people have been in the region for generations — these are their stories.

item.title: Geelong's strength-in-numbers approach fails its biggest test in AFL grand final loss
item.description: It is the cruel irony of sport that what is usually the ace up Geelong's sleeve proved to be its downfall in the loss to the Brisbane Lions in the season decider.

item.title: As Australia's retirement savings grow into world's second biggest, government to review consumer protections
item.description: Compulsory super has led to higher levels of national savings, but, as the pool of savings grows, many argue that stricter supervision is needed to protect Australians' retirement savings.

item.title: When it comes to love, more of us are crossing the religious divide
item.description: Exclusive data for 5.2 million couples shows nearly one in five marriages are between people of different religions – double the proportion recorded in 1986.

item.title: Hard Quiz Kids: Tom Gleeson's back to put Australia's pint-sized hot shots in their place
item.description: The grump's back to take on the grommets in a new series of Hard Quiz Kids. Don't let the pint-sized know-it-alls show you up.

item.title: Guy Sebastian reflects on Titus Day legal case and the lesson he's learned from fans
item.description: Guy Sebastian opens up about the fan encounter that made him "burst into tears" and a court case with his former manager, Titus Day.

item.title: Roosters on cusp of perfect NRLW season after beating Sharks 17-16
item.description: Jocelyn Kelleher is relishing the chance to prove her credentials as the Sydney Roosters look to claim back-to-back premierships for the first time in their history.

item.title: Woppaburra people welcome ancestor's return but face final hurdle
item.description: More First Nations remains are being returned to Australia from international institutions, but these Woppaburra men say laying them to rest on country can prove a fresh challenge.

item.title: England defeats Canada 33-13 in Women's Rugby World Cup final
item.description: In front of a record crowd of more than 80,000 spectators, England delivers on the biggest stage with a 33-13 defeat of Canada in the tournament decider at Twickenham.

item.title: A small win for beachgoers and gardeners as washed-up sea life turned to compost
item.description: Dead sea life washed ashore during SA's marine algal bloom has been diverted into commercial compost for farms and gardens, in what has been viewed as a small win amid the large-scale devastation.

item.title: Queensland's coal royalty regime back in the spotlight after job cuts
item.description: Despite a change of government, Queensland's controversial coal royalty scheme remains in place and recent job cuts are prompting renewed discussion about it.

item.title: Brisbane and Geelong fans experience the ecstasy and agony of AFL's biggest game
item.description: For the second year in a row, Brisbane Lions fans were celebrating in the streets as their team claimed the premiership.

item.title: One man dead, another seriously injured in Morwell incident
item.description: Homicide Squad detectives are investigating the death of a man in Victoria's east in an incident that left another man seriously injured.

item.title: Lions AFL coach Chris Fagan vindicated with Lachie Neale sub call in grand final win over Cats
item.description: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan admits he took a punt by naming Lachie Neale as the sub ahead of their stunning win over Geelong in the grand final.

item.title: Feral pigs illegally brought into SA from NSW, DNA testing confirms
item.description: Dozens of pigs were released illegally over several attempts to establish populations for hunting, with a local landscape board warning of the danger a feral population could cause.

item.title: Rod Barwick has international fame as a daffodil breeder, but what matters to him is a love of gardening
item.description: Rod Barwick planted his first daffodil bulbs in the 70s. Within a few years, he began breeding daffodils and has since been recognised internationally for his work — but he says enjoying growing plants is the most important part of gardening.

item.title: Thirty years ago, Oasis made (What's The Story) Morning Glory? — a Britpop blockbuster
item.description: They'll soon tour Australia, but 30 years ago, Oasis were about to release (What's The Story) Morning Glory? — an enduring British rock classic. Here's how they did it.

item.title: Ten-year-old mini bull rider from Cape York takes on world's best in Utah
item.description: In a huge dark hat and shining belt buckle, a 10-year-old from Cape York proves he can mix it with the best at the world finals in Utah.

item.title: Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda's family in calls for fresh probe into mystery disappearance
item.description: The family of vanished Yolŋu leader Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda is calling on the Northern Territory coroner to pursue an ABC investigation's lead on his mysterious disappearance.

item.title: No subscriptions? No problems! Here are the best movies and TV series you can watch for free
item.description: From family favourites to Australia's most controversial soap opera, here's some of the best movies and TV you can watch right now — no fee required!

item.title: Kununurra's Barra Bash barramundi competition underway as restocking solution sought
item.description: More than 1,000 fishers hope to reel in a winning catch at Lake Kununurra, where a restocking program and ideal conditions have grown record-size barramundi.

item.title: Anthony Albanese coy on critical minerals offer ahead of meeting with Donald Trump
item.description: The prime minister would not say exactly what Australia's critical minerals offer to the United States included — nor whether it was exclusive to the Trump administration, after he discussed the issue with his British counterpart.

item.title: Lions show they're the complete team by beating Cats to claim second straight AFL premiership
item.description: With contributors across the board, the Brisbane Lions clinically dismantled Geelong to show last year's premiership victory was no fluke.

item.title: It's OK on the Macleay poster vandalism prompts calls for queer acceptance
item.description: A regional queer community says acceptance is improving in regional areas, but vandalism targeting an LGBTQI+ event shows there is still a way to go.

item.title: Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco in star-studded ceremony
item.description: Singer, actor and beauty mogul Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco, with US media reporting Taylor Swift was in attendance at the star-studded affair.

item.title: Astronaut Katherine Bennell-Pegg says studying space will help Australia manage bushfires, floods
item.description: With Sydney to play host to the world's largest space conference this coming week, Katherine Bennell-Pegg says it is more important than ever to highlight the benefits of growing Australia's space workforce.

item.title: Australia's Kirra Wright claims silver at World Para Athletics Championships
item.description: At just 17, Kirra Wright reaches the podium at the world titles after setting a personal best in winning the silver medal in New Delhi.

item.title: The benefits and risks of sleeping next to your dog
item.description: While there are several benefits to keeping our pets close at night, there are a few minor risks to consider.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos beat Penrith Panthers to reach NRL grand final as Adam Reynolds kicks game-winning conversion
item.description: Adam Reynolds nails a sideline conversion with three minutes left to send the Broncos into the NRL grand final and end Penrith's dynasty with a 16-14 win at Lang Park.

item.title: Police investigate death of man at Brisbane shopping centre in early hours of Sunday morning
item.description: Police were called to a suburban shopping centre in the early hours of Sunday morning where they declared the man in his 40s dead.

item.title: Polar bears take over abandoned research station in Russian Arctic
item.description: A group of polar bears that have taken over an abandoned polar research station off Russia's coast is intimately captured in drone footage.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos beat Newcastle Knights to set up NRLW grand final against Sydney Roosters
item.description: Brisbane is back in the NRLW grand final for the first time in five years, setting up the long-awaited clash with the Sydney Roosters after a 30-6 win over Newcastle.

item.title: St Kilda pulls off record AFLW comeback, Ebony Marinoff, Ally Anderson celebrate milestone games
item.description: St Kilda outscores Port Adelaide 38-0 in the final quarter after trailing by 27 points at three-quarter-time, while Ally Anderson and Ebony Marinoff become the first players to feature in 100 AFLW games.

item.title: Four-year-old boy missing in remote South Australian mid-north since Saturday
item.description: The boy was last seen at his family homestead at about 5pm on Saturday.

item.description: Adam Reynolds took the kicking tee from the Broncos' biggest star in the biggest moment of their season so far, and it paid off in the biggest way possible.

item.title: Vietnam evacuates thousands as Typhoon Bualoi approaches
item.description: As Typhoon Bualoi approaches Vietnam, thousands of people are seeking safer ground.

item.title: Classified US intelligence warns of China's preparations for Taiwan invasion
item.description: A classified US intelligence report, seen by the ABC, says vessels have been modified to carry tanks and partake in amphibious operations in what Taiwan considers part of China's "expansionist intentions".

item.title: Donald Trump's 'climate hoax' comments belong to a well-resourced playbook landing on Australia's shores
item.description: US researchers have tracked how dark money funds a tangled web of climate denial think tanks with vested interests in slowing climate action. And Australia is not immune.

item.title: If China beats the US on fusion energy, its supremacy will be assured
item.description: China is driving hard to supplant the US in this new military industrial complex, and has already achieved leadership in electric vehicles, batteries, drones and renewable energy.

item.title: Anti-corruption chief Paul Brereton continued defence consulting after declaring he had resigned from role
item.description: The head of the national anti-corruption commission told a Senate inquiry he had resigned his role at the defence force's investigative arm. But the ABC has learned he continued consulting for them, and documents proving his resignation could not be identified.

item.title: Funding deal for research program about Australia's polar security rejected by Tasmanian government
item.description: A funding bid to establish a polar security research program has been knocked back, despite the changing geopolitical dynamics in Antarctica and the Southern Ocean.

item.title: How Astrid Jorgensen turned a suburban pub choir into a worldwide musical phenomenon
item.description: Astrid Jorgensen has an unusual condition — she finds many human noises unbearable. So how did she end up running the "world's biggest choir"?

item.title: Jewish patients say they feel ongoing fear months after Bankstown Hospital nurses video
item.description: Some members of Australia's Jewish community say they have experienced ongoing trauma and fear months after a video came to light that included threats to Israeli patients.

item.title: Family of Melbourne man Kwar Ater searching for answers after his shooting death
item.description: The 26-year-old was shot dead in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month, leaving his shocked family in search of answers.

item.title: Outback temperatures near 40C as Queensland school holidays continue
item.description: Clear, bright and sunny skies are expected as the Sunshine State's school holidays continue this week.

item.title: The deadly legacy of the 'forgotten pandemic' — and why it's drawing comparisons to COVID-19
item.description: It's been dubbed "the forgotten pandemic" — possibly because it coincided with some of the most momentous events in world history. But Dr John Gerrard argues variants of the H3N2 flu, which led to the Hong Kong flu pandemic, continue to cost lives.

item.title: Mark Nawaqanitawase outlines what he misses most about rugby union on Nesian Footy show
item.description: Mark Nawaqanitawase says there are many things he misses about rugby union, but moving to league is the best decision he has made in his life.

item.title: Grieving family frustrated at lack of licence reform after seven-year coronial inquest wait
item.description: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. His family feel their pleas for licence reforms have been ignored by the state government.

item.title: These Australians are homeless with a house
item.description: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for today's climate, let alone the future.

item.title: Four dead after gunman opens fire in a Michigan Mormon church service before setting it on fire
item.description: Hundreds of people were inside The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc Township when a 40-year-old man rammed his pick-up truck through the front door, then got out of the vehicle and started shooting.

item.title: Southern pygmy perch 'ear bones' provide data to re-establish populations
item.description: Information gleaned from tiny growth rings on "ear bones" of native pygmy perch could be the key to bringing them back from local extinction in the lower Murray.

item.title: Two charged with murder over Morwell stabbing incident that left one man dead
item.description: Homicide detectives have charged two males aged 16 and 19 with murder following the stabbing of an 18-year-old man in Victoria's east on Saturday night.

item.description: The government has quietly extended a contract for the running of asylum seeker services on Nauru until 2027, taking the cost to $787 million.

item.title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announces he is dropping his re-election bid after unpopular tenure
item.description: Eric Adams announces he is dropping his re-election bid, but says he will "continue to fight for this city" until his term ends on January 1, 2026.

item.description: Ivan Cleary says the NRL made a "huge call" in deciding to bench Scott Sorensen after a nasty head clash.

item.description: At 91, Pamela Allen has published more than 60 books. This exhibition brings her work off the page and invites children and adults to play as they read.

item.description: Road haulage industry leaders are planning a national campaign against using indicators as a signal it is safe to overtake.

item.description: India defeats Pakistan with just two balls remaining in the Asia Cup final, then refuses to claim the trophy.

item.description: The Victorian relief service that's fed those in need in the Wimmera for almost 30 years has had its funding slashed.

item.description: Mango growers in Western Australia's far north are on alert as a mysterious dieback disease decimates crops in the Northern Territory.

item.title: Sailors found with catamaran after extensive search off northern NSW coast
item.description: Two men have been rescued with their catamaran after being adrift for two days following an engine failure off the northern NSW coast.

item.description: Police allege the man stabbed a 44-year-old at a suburban Brisbane shopping centre before attempting to sexually assault a woman not known to him.

item.description: The rapid spread of canine ehrlichiosis since it was first detected in Australia five years ago "has left a lot of destruction in its wake", a veterinarian says.

item.description: Neither Melbourne nor Brisbane is approaching perfection ahead of their grand final showdown, but with what they've been through, neither team would want to.

item.description: Police provide an update after a review of CCTV, statements from witnesses, and the results of an autopsy after the discovery of a woman's body on Friday.

item.description: Three people face a Perth court accused of murdering 33-year-old Jayden Selfe, whose disappearance sparked an extensive investigation and led to the discovery of his body north of the city.

item.title: If you're looking to try out a career change, volunteering can give you a taste
item.description: If you're considering a career change, or want a taste of a new industry, volunteering can be a great option.

item.title: Donald Trump says he will tell US military leaders 'we love them' after Pete Hegseth summoned them for a meeting
item.description: The US president said he will tell military leaders "we love them, they're cherished leaders" during a meeting organised by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth.

item.title: Cycling great Tadej Pogačar rides away from the field to win men's road race world title in Rwanda
item.description: Tadej Pogačar makes more cycling history with another incredible win in the world championship road race on a brutally tough course in Rwanda.

item.title: Humanity's space ambition to be focus of first Powerhouse Parramatta exhibition
item.description: Humanity's ambition to explore beyond Earth will feature in the largest exhibition space in the country when Powerhouse Parramatta opens in the city's west.

item.description: Rory McIlroy supports his wife Erica, who was said to be on the receiving end of "astonishing" abuse from American fans during the Ryder Cup in New York.

item.description: Queensland Health will investigate reports patients did not receive crucial test results from north Queensland's largest public hospital.

item.description: Described as "a little boy in a very large body", the man who lit the blaze at the home of the YouTube comedian in 2022 apologised and said he would "rather die" than go back to jail.

item.title: Melbourne Storm prop Stefano Utoikamanu labels Brisbane Broncos 'stuck up', Xavier Willison free to play NRL grand final

item.description: Police say they've arrested four teenage boys in Melbourne's CBD after chasing them from Doncaster in the city's east.

item.title: Unregulated melatonin products had as much as four times the amount on label, TGA testing shows
item.description: The TGA has urged patients to stop using unregulated melatonin products after testing revealed “significant discrepancies” between their actual melatonin amount and what was on the label.

item.description: The "completely preventable" death of a three-year-old dolphin in Adelaide's Port River has prompted new calls for mandatory propeller guards on boats entering the sanctuary.

item.description: 47-year-old Stephen Fleming, who has pleaded guilty to manslaughter, is accused of ending his new housemate's life last year and stuffing the English teacher's body in a green waste bin.

item.description: Three police officers shot dead in the line of duty this year are being honoured as part of National Police Remembrance Day services around Australia.

item.description: Cradle Mountain is one of Tasmania's most popular, and dangerous, tourism destinations. After another tragedy, questions are asked about what more could be done to ensure the safety of visitors.

item.description: The Larrimah Hotel is sold again, after capturing the world's attention in podcasts and films about the disappearance of 70-year-old Paddy Moriarty.

item.description: SA Police conducted more than 1,600 metal detector searches at Burnside Village at the weekend, but the state's Guardian for Children and Young People says officials need to "get the balance right" amid a crackdown on knife crime.

item.title: India claim they were denied Asia Cup trophy after win over Pakistan
item.description: India T20 skipper Suryakumar Yadav has claimed that his team was denied the chance to lift the 2025 Asia Cup trophy, after it beat Pakistan in the final by five wickets on Sunday.

item.description: Noemie Fox has just missed out on a dream start to the ICF Slalom World Championships, finishing fifth in the kayak cross time trials.

item.description: A crime scene has been declared at Kenmore Hills after two people were found dead at a property just after midday on Monday.

item.title: Will Ashcroft named best AFL finals player to win Gary Ayres Award to add to Brisbane Lions accolades
item.description: Brisbane Lions midfield star Will Ashcroft has added the AFL coaches' award for player of the finals to his growing list of accolades in the wake of his team's 47-point victory over the Geelong Cats on Saturday.

item.title: James Tedesco is named best NRL player by his peers for the fourth time despite Roosters falling short in NRL finals
item.description: The 32-year-old fullback joins Johnathan Thurston as the only four-time winner of the players' champion award, after the Sydney Roosters star was voted the NRL's best player of 2025 by his peers.

item.title: Albanese invites Emirati retail giant Lulu Hypermarket to take on Coles and Woolworths
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has invited Emirati 'hypermarket' chain LuLu Group to set up shop on Australia's shores and take on supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths.

item.title: Caboolture Hospital to review medical scans amid concerns about outpatient service
item.description: A clinical team is reviewing the medical imaging results of up to 9,000 patients at Caboolture Hospital amid concerns about how results were communicated.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Rick Morton's book about Robodebt, Mean Streak, among Prime Minister's Literary Award winners
item.description: Journalist Rick Morton didn't want to write a book about Robodebt. Now that book, Mean Streak, has won the Prime Minister's Literary Award for non-fiction.

item.title: Federal budget deficit lower than forecast
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Four teens arrested in Melbourne CBD after police pursuit
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: US to impose 100pc tariff on movies made outside the country, Trump says
item.description: US President Donald Trump initially threatened to impose such levies earlier in May but offered few details, leading to confusion among entertainment industry executives.

item.title: Private equity consortium offers to buy Electronic Arts for $80 billion
item.description: A consortium of private equity companies, including one backed by Donald Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, is offering to take the video game giant private.

item.title: Inside Iran, a paranoid regime hunts for traitors and spies after its war with Israel
item.description: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.

item.title: Will the Reserve Bank cut interest rates today? Only if hell freezes over
item.description: With markets pricing next to no chance of an interest rate cut today, what are the chances of another RBA move before year's end?

item.title: What could Thriving Kids, the NDIS alternative for some children, look like?
item.description: Despite the government wanting its Thriving Kids program for children with "mild to moderate" developmental delay and autism to start next year, the system is yet to be designed.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu agrees to Donald Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan
item.description: Israel has agreed to a US proposal to end its war on Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump announce after holding talks at the White House.

item.title: Clock is ticking for Optus boss as triple-0 disaster escalates
item.description: Analysts say the Optus CEO should "leave quietly" now or risk a more public exit once the reviews into the company's recent outages are complete.

item.title: Consultancy bill to review 'struggling' submarine agency blows out to $12.1 million
item.description: The agency responsible for delivering AUKUS has spent five times what it first planned for consultants to review its operations.

item.title: Pro-EU party wins majority in Moldova election in setback for Russia
item.description: Moscow is accused of attempting to sway the election in favour of a pro-Russian party, but a majority of voters backed the pro-EU Party of Action and Solidarity.

item.title: Calvary St Luke's Hospital surgeries transferred after micro tears found in the floor
item.description: The shutdown of Calvary St Luke's Hospital will affect 40 planned surgeries this week, with 22 of those reallocated to nearby St Vincent's Hospital.

item.title: Tom Ballard's new show searches for the line between funny and offensive while pushing the comedy envelope
item.description: Comedian Tom Ballard is swapping a stand-up stage for a dramatic one as his new stage show asks, how do you remember a divisive figure?

item.title: Hawthorn Hawks AFLW lose Emily Bates to injury
item.description: Top-four aspirants Hawthorn are set to lose Emily Bates for the run towards the finals after the star midfielder suffered a shoulder injury.

item.title: Robot for lunar and Earth construction
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australian homes could soon be built by spider-like robot called Charlotte
item.description: Developers of a speedy, "spider-like" robot named Charlotte believe it could be building homes on Earth within years, and eventually further lunar exploration.

item.title: Queensland government writes off up to $4 million worth of COVID-19 fines years after they were issued
item.description: The government has confirmed Queensland's state-run debt collection agency has now "finalised" all debts related to COVID fines.

item.title: Teenage boys charged over car chase through Melbourne into Bourke Street Mall
item.description: Police have charged two 16 and 17-year-old boys in relation to a dangerous incident involving an allegedly stolen car being driven into the pedestrian-only Bourke Street Mall.

item.title: Trump outlines plan for 'eternal peace' in the Middle East
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: 'Huge change' to Australia's health system as registered nurses set to prescribe medication
item.description: Qualified registered nurses will soon be able to write prescriptions for medications, in a bid to ease pressure on a stressed public healthcare system.

item.title: First Nations Australians launch class action against Work for the Dole scheme
item.description: A class action on behalf of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people alleges a Commonwealth Work for the Dole scheme was tougher on remote participants than on jobseekers in cities.

item.title: Looming crisis for older Australian women who will retire into poverty if no urgent action taken, new report finds
item.description: Women's super balances are disproportionately impacted by events later in life, in addition to childcare duties, which could mean serious financial problems, research from Super Members Council (SMC) has found.

item.title: Rescue founders outraged as kitten Pierre dumped within hours of adoption
item.description: Just 12 hours after he was adopted, eight-month-old kitten Pierre was found in his carrier in the middle of the road, drenched after an overnight storm. Rescuers are urging owners to de-sex their cats, to help prevent other animals from enduring a similar ordeal.

item.title: Federal environment minister knew of rock art fears before granting Woodside North West Shelf extension
item.description: The federal environment minister was advised pollution from Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant may be causing irreversible changes to ancient rock art, before granting the company a 40-year extension with strict conditions.

item.title: Will Skelton to return for Wallabies against All Blacks in second Bledisloe Cup Test
item.description: Lock Will Skelton is set to return for the Wallabies ahead of the final round of the Rugby Championship against the All Blacks.

item.title: Alice the dachshund saved after becoming stuck down rabbit hole for six hours
item.description: A dachshund named Alice, who found herself stuck down a rabbit hole under a demountable building in Central Australia, has been rescued after a six-hour effort by a group of locals.

item.title: Matthew McConaughey and America Ferrera highlight the unsung heroes of deadly wildfires
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Agnes Water hospital plans in limbo as council rejects development approval extension
item.description: Hundreds of homes targeting the over-50s market are in staged construction on Queensland's central coast, but a council will not grant an extension for hospital plans.

item.title: Netanyahu vows to 'finish the job' if Hamas rejects Trump's peace plan
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Search continues for missing four-year-old boy Gus on property near Yunta
item.description: Police are continuing to search for a four-year-old boy who vanished while playing in sand at his family's isolated sheep grazing property near Yunta in a remote part of South Australia's north.

item.title: Detectives release CCTV of car being set alight in Burwood
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Federal politics live: Albanese urges 'all parties' to engage with Trump's Gaza plan
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese welcomes US President Donald Trump's proposal to end Israel's war on Gaza. Follow live.

item.title: What is Donald Trump's peace plan for Gaza?
item.description: US President Donald Trump has pitched a 20-point peace plan for Gaza, after meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Mitch Brown hits out at Bailey Smith and Patrick Dangerfield over 'homophobic' social media post from Geelong Mad Monday
item.description: Mitch Brown, the first AFL player to reveal he is bisexual, hits out at Bailey Smith and Patrick Dangerfield over a social media post from Mad Monday.

item.title: Moorambilla Voices choir
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Moorambilla Voices bush choir marks 20 years as former student credits it with saving his life
item.description: Justin Welsh says joining the Moorambilla Voices children's choir helped steer him away from the challenges that face many young men in small country towns.

item.title: Australian-made Apollo laser shoots down drone
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NATO embraces new Australian-made Star Wars-style lasers to counter Russian drones
item.description: A Canberra-made laser is about to become NATO's newest frontline defence against enemy drones, in a deal experts say could transform the future of warfare.

item.title: RBA live updates: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold but potential future moves closely watched
item.description: The RBA keeps the cash rate steady, with all eyes now turning to the final two meetings of the year. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Green carab beetles release tear gas smell in Geraldton while escaping heat
item.description: Often mistaken for a stink bug or Christmas beetle, this iridescent insect has descended on Geraldton with a tear gas-like odour.

item.title: Taliban imposes communication shutdown in Afghanistan after severing fibre optic connections
item.description: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan have imposed a nationwide shutdown of communications, weeks after they began severing fibre optic connections.

item.title: Queensland's former top bureaucrat Mike Kaiser paid almost $400,000 in 'termination benefits'
item.description: New figures released in the department's annual report reveal Mike Kaiser was paid "termination benefits" of $397,000 in the last financial year.

item.title: YouTube to pay Trump $33.46m following January 6 Capitol riots ban
item.description: Donald Trump sued parent company Alphabet and other social media companies after the platforms suspended his accounts in 2021.

item.title: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina dissolves government following deadly youth-led protests
item.description: Youth-led protests over water and power cuts in Madagascar lasted three days and were the largest the island had seen in years.

item.title: NSW Police release CCTV footage of drive-by shooting at Sydney home linked to drug dealers
item.description: Police have released footage showing the moment a gunman fired on a suburban Sydney home in July, with investigations into the matter continuing.

item.title: A tip cat and a depot duck become invaluable workmates
item.description: A playful tabby kitten and a ravenous Muscovy duck routinely amuse council staff in their respective workplaces.

item.title: Broncos second-rower Jordan Riki opens up about his quest for redemption in the 2025 NRL grand final
item.description: After suffering a heartbreaking loss in the 2023 NRL grand final, Jordan Riki says redemption is fuelling Brisbane's journey to the 2025 title.

item.title: Advocate calls out Kimberley's 'astronomical' fruit and vegetable prices
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis means fresh produce is more expensive for all Australians, but residents in some remote WA towns are paying up to triple for some items compared to city prices.

item.title: Alcoa confirms permanent shutdown of Kwinana alumina refinery, south of Perth
item.description: US aluminium giant Alcoa says there is no "sustainable" path to restarting its aluminium refinery in Perth after phasing out production at the facility.

item.title: Southern Cross Media and Seven West Media announce merger, Kerry Stokes to step down
item.description: Media magnate Kerry Stokes will stand down as chair of Seven West Media after the company announced plans to merge with Southern Cross Media.

item.title: Man's body found after fire destroys East Lismore house in northern NSW
item.description: A man has died in a house fire that caused a structural collapse in East Lismore, NSW. Investigators are trying to determine the cause of the blaze.

item.title: Glenn Maxwell out of NZ T20 International series after breaking arm
item.description: A brutal run of injuries continues for one of Australia's top white-ball cricketers, who is out of the T20 series against New Zealand.

item.title: Kane Cornes labels Geelong's Mad Monday antics 'disrespectful' and 'embarrassing'
item.description: Kane Cornes labels Geelong's Mad Monday antics "disrespectful" and "embarrassing", after a slew of social media posts raises eyebrows across the AFL community, including one referencing his Seven colleague Caroline Wilson.

item.title: Female teacher accused of abusing Sydney boys' school student
item.description: Police will allege the 24-year-old engaged in an "inappropriate relationship" with a 15-year-old boy in her care.

item.title: Trump's peace plan shows Netanyahu has outmanoeuvred yet another American president
item.description: For all US President Donald Trump's boasts about ending wars and being a worthy candidate for a Nobel Peace Prize, he has failed to end the war in Gaza and build a sustainable future for both Israelis and Palestinians. At least for now.

item.title: Police charge nine people over violent robberies in south-east Queensland
item.description: Detectives lay more than 100 charges following investigations into a series of alleged shootings, burglaries and violent robberies across south-east Queensland since July.

item.title: Why Bad Bunny is a controversial choice to headline Super Bowl half-time show
item.description: Grammy-award winning rapper and singer Bad Bunny receives mixed reactions to the news he will headline the 2026 Super Bowl half-time show.

item.title: Police investigating deaths of mother and daughter at Kenmore Hills house listed on Airbnb
item.description: Police are investigating the sudden deaths of a mother and daughter whose bodies were found at a property in Kenmore Hills in Brisbane.

item.title: Government instructs Optus to bring in 'external party' to review systems
item.description: Communications Minister Anika Wells has instructed Optus to bring in an "independent and external party" during a meeting with the heads of the embattled telco and its Singaporean parent company, Singtel.

item.title: James Tedesco pulls out of Kangaroos selection for Ashes to be best man at brother's wedding
item.description: Former Kangaroos captain James Tedesco has informed the Australian Rugby League that he will not be available for the upcoming Ashes series in England.

item.title: James Turner wins first gold medal for Australia at World Para Athletics Championships
item.description: Paralympic champion James Turner wins Australia's first gold medal of the World Para Athletics Championships, saluting in the 400m T36 event in Delhi.

item.title: NSW government loses music festival strip search case as woman awarded $93,000 in damages
item.description: A Sydney woman subjected to an unlawful strip search at a music festival has been awarded $93,000 in damages, in a judgement that could see thousands of others also receive compensation.

item.title: Lily Ridgeway found not guilty of Raymond Terrace manslaughter of Jason Adams
item.description: Lily Ridgeway, 27, has been found not guilty of manslaughter over the 2020 death of Jason Adams in the NSW Hunter Valley.

item.title: How Brisbane's culture of empowerment has allowed its youngsters to be fearless on the AFL's biggest stage
item.description: Brisbane's youngest players rise to the occasion on the biggest stage, led by its 21-year-old Norm Smith medallist Will Ashcroft. Here's how the two-time premiers allow their kids to thrive.

item.title: Donald Day Jr, US conspiracy theorist connected to Wieambilla killers, agrees to watered-down plea deal
item.description: Donald Day Jr had been in regular online contact with Gareth, Nathaniel and Stacey Train before they shot two police officers and a neighbour in December 2022.

item.title: New Spirit of Tasmania vessels need hull upgrades in case of 'extreme' weather, TT-Line says
item.description: The new Bass Strait ferries have both been completed but new works are needed after an issue with the vessels' hull specifications was detected.

item.title: Werribee man found not guilty of deliberately setting neighbour on fire over loud music dispute
item.description: Michael Gauci, who was accused of setting a neighbour on fire after arguing over loud music, has been found not guilty of attempted murder.

item.title: RBA leaves interest rates on hold in September
item.description: The Reserve Bank leaves interest rates on hold at 3.6 per cent, having cut them at its previous meeting in August.

item.title: Calls for investigation after thousands of scans may not have been reviewed by doctors at Caboolture Hospital
item.description: Queensland's premier has called for an independent investigation into the problem, affecting up to 9,000 patients at Caboolture Hospital dating back to April 2023.
